enrichments.extra_info: You can pause Starlink service unlimited times per year with no restrictions. When you pause, you keep the remaining balance of the current billing month, but it will be lost when you resume. Best practice: pause at the end of your monthly cycle to minimize waste. The service operates on a 30-day billing cycle.

enrichments.guide_title: Solar Panel Installation - Flexible vs Rigid Panels
image_suggestions: Flexible solar panel curved on motorhome roof
Rigid solar panel with frame mounted on motorhome roof rails
Side-by-side comparison of flexible vs rigid solar panel profiles
Solar panel installation showing spacing for cooling airflow
Renogy vs Victron solar panels comparison chart
MPPT solar charge controller wiring diagram
enrichments.extra_info: Flexible panels are 95% thinner than rigid panels, can bend to curved surfaces, and are ideal for stealth installations. However, they require proper ventilation to prevent overheating. Rigid panels offer better long-term performance and cooling. Victron panels have higher open circuit voltage (45.8V for 215W) vs Renogy (27V for 200W), which is advantageous in cloudy conditions. Renogy panels offer 25-year warranty with 95% output after 5 years. Both brands compatible with various MPPT charge controllers (12V/24V/48V systems).

enrichments.guide_title: Solar Panel Installation and Efficiency Tips
image_suggestions: Solar panel with elevated mounting brackets showing air gap
Diagram showing airflow cooling under solar panel
Temperature comparison: flush-mounted vs elevated panel installation
enrichments.extra_info: Leaving a small gap (typically 1-3 inches) between solar panels and roof improves cooling efficiency. The air gap cools the roof more than it cools the panel itself, but overall system efficiency improves. Proper ventilation prevents panel overheating which can reduce output and shorten lifespan. This is especially critical for flexible panels which can overheat when glued directly to insulating roof surfaces.

enrichments.guide_title: France Toll Road Navigation and Cost Avoidance
image_suggestions: Google Maps showing 'Avoid Tolls' option enabled
French toll booth with pricing display for different vehicle classes
Motorhome classification diagram showing height/weight/length thresholds
Google Maps route comparison: toll vs toll-free route in France
enrichments.extra_info: France toll pricing is based on vehicle classification: over 3.5 tons weight, over 3 meters height, or over 6 meters length = truck rates (significantly more expensive). Google Maps 'Avoid Toll Roads' option effectively bypasses toll stations by routing you off highway before toll and back on after. Speed camera fines in France are approximately €80 even for minor violations. Use speed camera warning apps like CamSam to avoid fines.

enrichments.guide_title: StarLink vs Cellular Data: Consumption and Management Comparison
image_suggestions: WiFi vs cellular data usage comparison chart
Starlink data consumption monitoring dashboard
Phone settings showing app data restrictions
Background app activity on WiFi vs cellular comparison
Michelin/Maps app data usage statistics
enrichments.extra_info: WiFi triggers unrestricted downloading unlike cellular. Phones/computers assume WiFi = unlimited home connection, enabling: automatic OS updates, app updates, cloud backups (iCloud, Google Photos), background content downloading. Common data hogs: Michelin app (Maps), Google Maps, Waze, YouTube, cloud sync services. Starlink pricing: Chile 50GB=$45/month, USA 50GB=$50/month, USA Unlimited=$180/month. Argentina cellular: 40GB=$25/60 days. Management strategies: 1) Turn off Starlink when not needed, 2) Use cellular when available (cheaper than overage), 3) Disable auto-updates, 4) Manually close apps after use, 5) Turn off WiFi on inactive devices, 6) Monitor app network access in settings. Example: User consumed 40GB in 7 days on WiFi vs normal cellular usage.
